sub_title: PhD, Project Manager and Funding Advisor Virology at Utrecht University, Veterinary Medicine
summary:
Sander is Project Manager and research Funding Advisor at the Virology division of Veterinary Medicine at Utrecht University. I support the lead scientists in their research on (corona)viruses so that they can focus on what they do best: their science. My main responsibilities include: i) maintaining an overview of scientific and financial progress of ongoing projects, ii) coordinating communication with our partners and funding agencies, and iii) co-development of new projects and project proposals to acquire new funds. This is a great place to combine my academic and commercial experience. Follow our twitter to stay up to date about the groups' work: https://twitter.com/UtrechtVirology

Before joining the Virology division at UU, I was Consultant at ttopstart, a science and business consulting company that serves the fields of life sciences, medical technology and healthcare. At ttopstart, I supported leading researchers and innovative companies to shape wild ideas into executable and funded projects with the best consortia.

Sander performed his PhD research in laboratories at both the Hubrecht Institute, Utrecht and the Netherlands Cancer Institute, Amsterdam. For this, he investigated how tumor cells can exchange extracellular vesicles, which enables cancer cells to take advantage of each other’s divergent properties, influencing tumor growth and metastasis. He received his education from Utrecht University, where he acquired a Bachelor’s in Biology and a Master (cum laude) in Biomedical Sciences, for which he also worked at the University of California, San Francisco.

treasury_media.title: Utrecht Virology Lab
treasury_media.description:
Utrecht Virology Lab @UtrechtVirology

We perform fundamental research on viruses and translate this knowledge into new methods to prevent or treat infections | Tweets by group members.

treasury_media.title: Virology Division, Faculty of Veterinary Medicine, Utrecht University
treasury_media.description: Research to unravel RNA viruses (e.g. coronaviruses, influenza virus, picornaviruses, and RSV).

treasury_media.title: ttopstart - Subsidies & funding consulting, strategy and innovation
treasury_media.description: ttopstart is a science and business consulting company specialized in subsidies and funding, project management and business development in the fields of life sciences, medical technology and healthcare.

treasury_media.title: Van Rheenen, J. Group
treasury_media.description: The van Rheenen group studies the identity, behavior, and fate of cells that drive tumor initiation, progression, metastasis and the development of therapy resistance. These populations of cells are difficult to study since they are rare, and their behavior (e.g. migration) and traits (e.g. stemness) change over time. To be able to study these cells, we have developed microscopy techniques to visualize individual cells in real-time in living animals, referred to as intravital microscopy.

treasury_media.title: Diverse regulation of mammary epithelial growth and branching morphogenesis through noncanonical Wnt signaling
treasury_media.description: The extracellular signals that regulate cell growth and tissue rearrangements during organogenesis are still poorly understood.  Here, we show that two closely related members of the WNT superfamily influence the development of the mammary gland by signaling through different tyrosine kinase receptors. Together, the distinct actions of these highly homologous extracellular cues regulate the developmental processes that supply cells and shape tissues during periods of rapid growth.

treasury_media.title: Studying extracellular vesicle transfer by a Cre-loxP method
treasury_media.description:
Nature Protocols 11, 87–101 (2016) doi:10.1038/nprot.2015.138 Published online 10 December 2015

Studying extracellular vesicle transfer by a Cre-loxP method
Anoek Zomer, Sander Christiaan Steenbeek,	Carrie Maynard & Jacco van Rheenen

authors.headline: PhD, Project Manager and Funding Advisor Virology at Utrecht University, Veterinary Medicine

profile_positions.description: As a Project Manager of the Virology section (Department BHS) of the Faculty of Veterinary Medicine I play a crucial role in supporting the lead scientists in their research on coronaviruses. Among other things, I manage the administrative processes surrounding several large grants, help write (scientific) reports and quotations, help structure and coordinate internal processes and assist the lead scientists so that they can focus on science.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Virology

profile_positions.description: My position at The Netherlands Cancer Institute (2017-present) is a continuation of my PhD candidate position at the Hubrecht Institute (2014-2017) as the van Rheenen group moved host institutes in 2017.

profile_positions.title: PHD Candidate

profile_positions.description: University of California, San Francisco (UCSF), Zena Werb lab. Minor master internship on Wnt signaling pathway in the mouse mammary system. During this project I further characterized the role of noncanonical Wnt signalling in the mammary stem cells. I used lentivirus infected mammary epithelial transplants and mammosphere organoid cultures in combination with FACS, immunostaining, Western blot and RT-qPCR.
profile_positions.title: Junior Specialist / Masters Student

company.name: Hubrecht Institute, Developmental Biology and Stem Cell Research

profile_positions.company: Hubrecht Institute, Developmental Biology and Stem Cell Research
profile_positions.description: Hubrecht Institute, Utrecht, The Netherlands, Geijsen lab. Major master internship on the development of a novel p53-fusion protein for P53 re-integration into cancer cell lines. During this project I cloned recombinant versions of p53 to the non-lethal cell penetrating part of the Anthrax Toxin, purified the protein from E. coli and confirmed nuclear activity in p53-/- cancer cell lines using dual-luciferase reporter assays.
profile_positions.title: Masters Student

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer for conservation and restoration in National Parks and wilderness areas.
